intro: Daucus levis, commonly known as the slender cowpea, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is often found in disturbed soils. Its fruits are small, dry pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Daucus levis is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
